item.title: Shah-nameh by Firdausi.
notes: Paper: cream-color Eastern laid paper; black ink with with highly decorated major ʻunwāns; minor ʻunwāns in gold ink, now very faded; four columns enclosed in a thin red-blue-yellow border; text begins on folio 1b with rubrication and gold interlinear decoration up to folio 3a; folios 1b and 2a have elaobroate border of grape decoration in various shades of green and gold; catchwords on rectos.
Browne, E. G. Literary history of Persia, v. 1, p. 110-123
Nastaʻliq; 25 lines in written area 25 x 15.5 cm
Full page paintings on folios 1a, 144a, 193b, 412b; half-page paintings on folios 10a, 10b, 127a, 157b, 193a, 230a409a; two small paintings in lower corners on folios 133a, 402a.
Early dark brown 20th century Library of Congress binding.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
medium: 3, 422, 3 leaves (25 lines) bound : paper ; 37.5 x 26 cm

subject: manuscripts, persian
india
washington (d.c.)
title: Shah-nameh by Firdausi.
description: Manuscript. Persian. Binder's title. Written in India. Paper: cream-color Eastern laid paper; black ink with with highly decorated major ʻunwāns; minor ʻunwāns in gold ink, now very faded; four columns enclosed in a thin red-blue-yellow border; text begins on folio 1b with rubrication and gold interlinear decoration up to folio 3a; folios 1b and 2a have elaobroate border of grape decoration in various shades of green and gold; catchwords on rectos. Browne, E. G. Literary history of Persia, v. 1, p. 110-123 Nastaʻliq; 25 lines in written area 25 x 15.5 cm Full page paintings on folios 1a, 144a, 193b, 412b; half-page paintings on folios 10a, 10b, 127a, 157b, 193a, 230a409a; two small paintings in lower corners on folios 133a, 402a. Folio 1a-422a Library of Congress. Persian manuscript, 304/37. Early dark brown 20th century Library of Congress binding. Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
